thread.title: Rutgers vs. Indiana | Greetings from the press box
thread.title_full: Rutgers vs. Indiana | Greetings from the press box

author: Keith Sargeant | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Rutgers vs. Indiana | Greetings from the press box
text:
Comments 
BLOOMINGTON, Ind. â€” Rutgers reaches the midway point of its season Saturday afternoon, facing an Indiana team that can reach the doorstep of bowl-eligibility with a win. 
While the Scarlet Knights (2-3) have a ways to go to reach the six-win plateau, a win will guarantee that games in November will mean something. With games against top-ranked Ohio State, Wisconsin and No. 12 Michigan next on the docket, a loss will put Rutgers in a precarious position in its quest to reach a bowl for the 10th time in 11 years. 
Rutgers arrived here at Memorial Stadium shortly before 1, and began warming up in anticipating for only its second road game of the season. Shot from long distance in the press box but that's Kyle Flood and his son on the field pic.twitter.com/PmKK6Yftln
